item.title: France attacks
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Justin Bieber, post:84, topic:553835”][quote author=jme link=topic=672756.msg4499064#msg4499064 date=1447779898]

Not every Muslim is a terrorist, but every terrorist is a Muslim. And David go choke on your mothers black dick you insensitive bitch.

Wrong. The number one cause of terrorism in europe is seperatists. Muslims rank number 6 on the list. Jewish extremism is also a problem in middle east.
http://www.loonwatch.com/2010/01/terrorism-in-europe/ “all terrorists are muslim, except for the 99.6% that aren’t”

You don’t have to agree with the opinons of the article but the data is backed by Europol.

It isn’t all islam in the united states either. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terrorism_in_the_United_States

But it’s worth pointing out that terrorism in the name of islam does tend to be more deadly. Seperatists will firebomb a government office with no one inside, at 3am.
[/quote]So that just needs to be adjusted to “all terrorists that attack people are muslims”?[/quote]

That statement would still be wrong. But they have indeed killed the most people compared to other terrorist groups, despite far fewer attacks in total.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:7, topic:553835”][quote author=blood shade link=topic=672756.msg4498834#msg4498834 date=1447475386]
Wow no wonder you guys are losing the player base left and right no one wants to be here with you fudgeing 5 year olds. This is sad and tragic and you guys post jokes like nothing. Keep on making those “OMG OUR SITE IS DYING WHAT DO WE DO!!?” threads guys. No one wants to be here.
[/quote]You’re right. it was when we were all joking about Katrina that the site started to die. why could no one see it before!

We should all just do what every other damn person on the internet does. “MY THOUGHTS AND PRAYERS TO ALL THE FAMILIES”. Posting shit like that is so stupid and is just a way to get some attention for yourself in a time of tragedy. Because you definitely need to post about how awful it is, just to make sure everyone knows you’re so compassionate, right? If you can’t take a joke, get off the internet.

My personal favorite:
You know the real reason I feel sorry for the people on the upper floors of the World Trade Center before the attacks? They ordered pepperoni pizza but they only got plain.[/quote]One rep++ = one prayer

I definitely think ISIS should be defeated, but not at the cost of innocent lives in the region. But trying to destabilise countries like Syria and Libya is stupid and should never have been done.

item.title: France attacks
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:73, topic:553835”]If you were a middle-easterner, do you just let US bomb your country?

US created ISIS, so if ISIS attacks US, it’s 100% your fault as a country. I’m not as bad as you were, I’ve never supported the nuking of Japan.[/quote]
You didn’t answer my question. And I don’t support the nuking of Japan? Maybe back in my rightwing zealot days.

And there you go, you’re now at the impasse everyone else is. No you don’t let your country get bombed, and that’s the vicious cycle that’s been going on for a while now. Both sides want revenge. This is why dealing with it is so difficult. But some could argue you can’t just stop retaliating, because ISIS doesn’t forgive or forget, and giving them a chance to develop more can cause more problems.

I don’t know how to deal with it, and I don’t think exchanging attacks back and forth is the solution. What do you think should be done?

Read full topic

item.title: France attacks
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:72, topic:553835”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=672756.msg4499011#msg4499011 date=1447699963]
Frell: You saying you aren’t using it as an excuse, doesn’t change the fact that you are using it as an excuse.
[/quote]
I never used it as an excuse for the government. I used it as a valid excuse for the people not having as much control as you think.

But I do think US deserve any shit coming their way.

So what if you were born in the US, grew up here, everyone you knew was here, and you didn’t agree with the government? What would you do? Start a revolution? Not pay taxes? Move? Lol.

You make very little sense, you’re worse than I used to be. I won’t even start on you comparing a large scale terrorist attack to a traffic accident.[/quote]
If you were a middle-easterner, do you just let US bomb your country?

US created ISIS, so if ISIS attacks US, it’s 100% your fault as a country. I’m not as bad as you were, I’ve never supported the nuking of Japan.

Read full topic

item.title: France attacks
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Bowser jr:

Americans and their excuses for their government’s actions…

Bowser, read my fudgeing shit

Frell:

Not using it as an excuse, in the end it’s a shitty situation all over fueled by ignorance and anger which should never go together.

I never once said this is ok or defended France/USs military. I’m defending you throwing every citizen in the pot of liking what their government does, because you basically just said the people of France deserved this. I’m sorry every country can’t be the size of your local neighborhood playground like Norway. It’s easy for you to point fingers from your high horse, what if you were born in France and didn’t agree with what they were doing but still lived there, and you were just walking home from work that night?

I didn’t say people don’t support military intervention, but I can say it definitely isn’t every citizen by far. If a candidate plans for many good domestic policies but has shit foreign policy people will bite the bullet and still choose them. It’s no shocker that the average voter will prioritize their own country over foreign policy. You also have the issues of poor education, people thinking striking back blindly in the middle east is the answer, when those attacks will inevitably kill civilians too and be used to fuel more recruitment on the other end.

Read full topic

Great logic.[/quote]I didn’t say that 100 deaths justifies 1000 foreign civvie deaths. I don’t think it’s right to even compare the value of life like that. Do you not think intention is a more important distinction?
